resource.name: 2010 Census Blocks
resource.description: 2010 Census Block polygons for all of Pierce County, realigned to Pierce County roads, parcels, hydro, railroads, powerlines, etc. Population figures for race, ethnicity, median age, household size, household count, etc were downloaded from the US Census website and joined to this layer. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbis_census2010_blocks.html). Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Sheriff Patrol Districts
resource.description: This theme shows the Law Districts only in unincorporated Pierce County. It was created to be used by SouthSound911 (SS911) to identify and display different Law Districts and their boundaries. This feature class is registered to the SS911 CAD system, ortho-based roads and shifted annexations. Law Districts are created by dissolving Law ESZ's by District. Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdblesa_patrol_districts.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf). Additional SS911 Terms of Use found in the metadata.

resource.name: County Facilities with Divisions
resource.description: This theme contains county facilities with division information including district courts, sheriff precincts, ferry terminals, solid waste facilities. Not included in this feature class are county owned/managed parks, golf courses and recreation centers. These facilities can be found in the parks layer. Please read the metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbis_county_facilities_divisions.html). Any use or data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Stormwater Manholes
resource.description: Approximate locations of existing manholes in the stormwater system owned, operated and maintained by Pierce County PWU-Sewer and Water Utilities Division as well as the private stormwater pipelines that connect into the Pierce County system. Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbsewr_swmanholes.html) for additional information. Any use or data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Stormwater Channels
resource.description: Approximate locations of existing channels in the stormwater system owned, operated and maintained by Pierce County PWU-Sewer and Water Utilities Division. Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbsewr_swchannels.html) for additional information. Any use or data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Traffic Signals and Beacons
resource.description: This point data displays Pierce County owned traffic signals, flashers, and beacons. Please read metadata for additional information. Description: This point theme displays Pierce County owned traffic signals, flashers, and beacons. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbpubw_traffic_signal_beacons.html). Any use or data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Bridges - Supplemental
resource.description: This dataset includes; Railroad Bridges, Private Road Bridges, City Bridges, National Park Bridges, JBLM Bridges, Pedestrian Bridges. This feature class does not contain bridges owned or maintained by either the county or state. These feature classes are in a separate feature class.  This data should not be considered complete.  Bridges are added to this data as they are discovered while the road data is being maintained.  A bridge is added to this data if it is not found in the WADOT Bridge data or the Washington Bridge Inventory System (WBIS).  Please see metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbis_bridges_supplemental.html). Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Behavioral Health Providers
resource.description: A list of Behavioral Health Providers in Pierce County Washington

resource.name: River Routes
resource.description: Polylines subset of the "Hydro-Centerlines" dataset including the major rivers and some streams with routing added so mileposts could be calculated when no physical river milepost was available (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbswm_river_routes.html). Please read metadata for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Traffic Signals and Beacons
resource.description: This point data displays Pierce County owned traffic signals, flashers, and beacons. Please read metadata for additional information. Description: This point theme displays Pierce County owned traffic signals, flashers, and beacons. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbpubw_traffic_signal_beacons.html). resource.name: Tax Parcels
resource.description: Tax parcel polygons throughout Pierce County, including condos, but not including mobile homes which can be found in the "Mobile Home" layer instead. Parcel number is the unique identifier and additional parcel attribution can be found here (https://www.co.pierce.wa.us/736/Data-Downloads). Click the link for Use Code Descriptions (https://www.co.pierce.wa.us/DocumentCenter/View/604/Use-Code-Listing?bidId=). Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbparc_taxparcel.html) for additional information. Any use or data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf). If you have questions or need supplemental information, please call the Assessor-Treasurer Operations Team at 253-798-3134.

resource.name: Railroads
resource.description: Polylines representing the rail network in Pierce County, not including tracks that have been abandoned. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.piercecountywa.gov/GISmetadata/pdbtrans_railroads.html). Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.piercecountywa.gov/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf). Please see provided hyperlinks for metadata and Terms of Use.

resource.name: Pierce County Behavioral Health Providers
resource.description: A look at Behavioral Health Providers in Pierce County Washington

resource.name: Cities - Annexations
resource.description: Annexation polygons throughout Pierce County that have passed by city ordinance or resolution and comprise the current incorporated cities of Pierce County. Proposed annexations submitted for pre-review are also included. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbtrans_annexations.html). Any use or data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: 2010 Census Block Groups
resource.description: 2010 Census Block Group polygons (have the same first digit of their four-digit identifiers within a census tract) for all of Pierce County, realigned to Pierce County roads, parcels, hydro, railroads, power lines, etc. Population figures for race, ethnicity, median age, household size, household count, etc were downloaded from the US Census website and joined to this layer. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbis_census2010_block_groups.html). Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Traffic Volume
resource.description: This dataset geographically displays information about ADT data from the County Road Administration Board (CRAB) GIS-Mo database. GIS-Mo database replaced the old Mobility database. Please read the metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbtrans_GISMO_tblADT.html) for additional information. Any data download or use constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (http://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Pavement – Shoulder
resource.description: This dataset geographically displays information about other road lanes data from the County Road Administration Board (CRAB) GIS-Mo database. GIS-Mo database replaced the old Mobility database. Please read the metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbtrans_GISMO_RLXShoulder.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Sewer Lift Stations
resource.description: Approximate locations of existing sewer lift stations in the sanitary sewer system owned, operated and maintained by Pierce County PWU-Sewer and Water Utilities Division as well as the private sanitary sewer pipelines that connect into the Pierce County system. Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbsewr_ssliftstation.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: School Grounds
resource.description:
This point theme shows the center point of the school boundary. Public schools were verified using the Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction school district website https://www.k12.wa.us/about-ospi/about-school-districts/websites-and-contact-info. which has a link to the district website. This data does not contain preschools which are available in Child Care Centers. Internet based schools that don't have a physical location are not included in this data.

Colleges, Universities,Technical and private schools were verified using the schools website.

resource.name: Sewer Treatment Plants
resource.description: Approximate locations of existing sewer treatment plants in the sanitary sewer system owned, operated and maintained by Pierce County PWU-Sewer and Water Utilities Division as well as the private sanitary sewer pipelines that connect into the Pierce County system. Please read metadata (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbsewr_sstreatmentplant.html) for additional information. Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Transportation Improvement Program TIP (pts)
resource.description: Approximate point locations for planned projects on new and existing facilities in the comprehensive transportation project.  Projects are for unincorporated Pierce County for the ensuing six calendar years.  Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbtrans_trans_improvement_program_pts.html). Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Council Districts - Pierce County
resource.description: The data represents the Pierce County Council Districts Boundaries for elections through 2031. The County Council Districts were adopted on December 16, 2021 by the Pierce County Districting Committee which is appointed by the Pierce County Council. Redistricting is done once every ten years based on census data. The 2020 census population data was used to adjust the district boundaries. Redistricting is the process of changing district boundaries so that each district is nearly equal in population. Redistricting is covered in the Washington State Legislature Chapter 29A.76 RCW. Pierce County is made up of seven council districts. One council person is elected from each district that represents at the county level. Please read metadata for additional information (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/GISmetadata/pdbaudit_council_districts.html). Any data download constitutes acceptance of the Terms of Use (https://matterhorn.co.pierce.wa.us/Disclaimer/PierceCountyGISDataTermsofUse.pdf).

resource.name: Speed Limit
resource.description: The GIS-Mo Speed Limit data displays speed limit information.
